description: The cause of the issue described by CVE-2023-6511 stems from an inappropriate implementation in the autofill feature of the Chromium open-source software, which is the foundation for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). This flaw can expose users to potential risks when sensitive information may be mishandled by the autofill functionality. As reported, Microsoft Edge version 120.0.2210.61 has addressed this vulnerability through updates derived from the Chromium releases. The detailed corrective action ensures that users of the latest Edge version are no longer vulnerable to this specific flaw. The KB Article associated with this resolution is KB-120.0.2210.61, serving as a reference for further details on the update and its implications.
